entry.title: Bitcoin Core 28.3 Release Candidate 2 Available
entry.summary:
The recent announcement regarding Bitcoin Core's new version v28.3rc2 highlights the availability of binaries which interested parties can download from [Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.3/test.rc2/). This update serves as a release candidate for a forthcoming major version release, indicating its significance in the development cycle. For those looking to delve deeper into the specifics or contribute to its refinement, the source code has been made accessible on GitHub under a signed tag, which can be found [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v28.3rc2).
Accompanying this announcement, preliminary release notes have been shared to provide users and developers with an overview of the changes, improvements, and any potential issues addressed in this release. These notes are crucial for understanding the impact of the new version and can be reviewed [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v28.3rc2/doc/release-notes.md).
Release candidates play an essential role in the software development process, serving as test versions before the final release. They are instrumental in identifying and rectifying critical problems. The communication stresses that if no significant issues are detected, this candidate will officially become version v28.3.
This information was disseminated to subscribers of the "Bitcoin Development Mailing List" group, ensuring that developers and interested parties are informed about the latest advancements and have the opportunity to participate in the testing and feedback process.
